dependent workloads um next is memory
Affinity um this one does behave a

when a node is initiating a shutdown for
whatever reason on Linux um the cubet
places an inhibitor on the system D

that um in the event of any like planned
or unplanned outages that are not fatal
to the system it'll give the workloads
enough time to finish up handling
whatever requests they're doing and um
shut down gracefully and then have those
requests or workloads be moved to nodes
